p: Several in vitro and in vivo studies reported the immunomodulatory effects of A. cepa in different diseases. In ovalbumin-sensitised Wistar rats, A. cepa aqueous extract (0.175, 0.35, and 0.7 mg/mL, oral) caused reductions in IL-4 and IgE levels, and increased the level of IFN-γ and IFN-γ/IL4 ratio (Th1/Th2 balance) indicating its stimulatory effect on Th 1 but inhibitory effect on Th 2 activity (Marefati et al. 2018).
